intro: Amischotolype marginata, commonly known as the marginated amischotolype, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves with wavy margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
